roleset.name: give
roleset.note: HAND-V NOTES: Frames file for 'hand' based on sentences in financial subcorpus andautomatic expansion via verbnet. (from hand.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: hand-v: double object
example.text: ``We don't just hand the customer the package.

roleset.name: give
roleset.note: HANDOVER-N NOTES: Based on Ontonotes nouns. Comparison to hand.02. No VN or FN classes. Framed by Katie. (from handover.01-n)

example.name: hand_over-v: all args
example.text: As he handed over the reins to successor Charles A. Corry, steel profits were close to a cyclical peak.

example.name: handover-n: Args 1 and 2
example.text: Hong Kong's handover to China

roleset.name: give
roleset.note: HAND_OUT-V NOTES: VN updated by Julia. Member of VNcls contribute-13.2. (from hand.03-v)

example.name: hand_out-v: unstated recipient
example.text: But United Media says it's very scrupulous with the contracts *trace* it hands *trace* out.

roleset.name: be in possession of
roleset.note: IN_ONES_HANDS-M NOTES: Added by Tim/Julia during initial MWE framing.

example.name: have_hands-m: have hands on
example.text: How excited am I-1 *PRO*-1 to have my hands on THIS potential #foodwaste solution!

example.name: have_in_hand-m
example.text: ...it would not be reasonable that a society having a right to borrow to the extent of two thirds of the amount of their mortgages should be called upon suddenly to repay sums of money which-1 they might not have *trace*-1 in hand, or under their immediate control.

example.name: have_in_hand-m
example.text: The efforts of volunteers do not obviate the need *PRO* to have in hand a large amount of money for the translating and printing of each translation.
example.arg: for the translating and printing of each translation

example.name: in_hand-m: in the hands of
example.text: A large percentage of the nation's wealth is in the hands of a very, very few people.
example.arg: A large percentage of the nation's wealth
of a very, very few people

example.name: get_hands-m
example.text: All I-1 had to do was *-1 get my hot little hands on the police report.

example.name: get_hands-m: get_hands on
example.text: “I just wish I could have got my hands on the big CDOT snow plow,” he said with a grin.
example.arg: on the big CDOT snow plow

example.name: into_hands-m: fall into the hands of
example.text: Power fell into the wrong hands.

roleset.name: have responsibility or control over a task or event
roleset.note: IN_ONES_HANDS-M NOTES: Added by Tim/Julia during initial MWE framing.

role.descr: bearer of responsibility, person with power

example.name: in_hands-m: with possessive
example.text: central bankers don't really have to worry about who's elected to office as long as the private creation and allocation of credit remains safely in their hands.
example.arg: the private creation and allocation of credit

example.name: in_hands-m
example.text: Regardless of the moral aspect, you are putting all the decision making power of this relationship in his hands.
example.arg: all the decision making power of this relationship

example.name: in_hands-m
example.text: I put my life in the hands of the surgeons.

example.name: in_hands-m, entity as arg1
example.text: The surgery itself is slick , modern and very relaxed and I always felt that I was in capable hands .

mappings.source: (A / change-01 :arg1 (n1 / NARG1) :arg2 (b2 / be-located-at-91 :arg1 n1 :arg2 (B / hand :part-of (n2 / NARG2))) :arg3 (b3 / be-located-at-91 :arg1 n1 :arg2 (B / hand :part-of (n3 / NARG3))))
mappings.target: (A / transfer-01 :arg1 (n1 / NARG1 :arg1-of (o / own-01 :arg0 n2)) :arg2 (n3 / NARG3) :arg3 (n2 / NARG2))

example.name: change_hands-m
example.text: 4.4 million shares changed hands.

example.name: change_hands-m
example.text: The food got a lot worse after the restaurant changed hands

example.name: changing_of_hands-m
example.text: The border’s changing of hands between England and Scotland caused confusion

roleset.name: not in possession of
roleset.note: OUT_OF_HANDS-M NOTES: Added by Tim/Julia during initial MWE framing.

example.name: out_of_hands-m
example.text: The United Nations Security Council passed a resolution on April 25, 2008 that will keep weapons of mass destruction out of the hands of terrorists.

roleset.name: not in control of, not tasked with
roleset.note: OUT_OF_HANDS-M NOTES: Added by Tim/Julia during initial MWE framing.

example.name: out_of_hands-m
example.text: More important, he would take the investigation out of my hands, and that was something I couldn't allow

example.name: out_of_hands-m
example.text: And speaking of matters out of my hands, I must see Gigot to arrange a meal for the Guards.

roleset.name: uncontrolled, wild
roleset.note: OUT_OF_HAND-M NOTES: Added by Tim/Julia during initial MWE framing.

example.name: out_of_hand-m: AMR
example.text: inally, the contradictions are bound to intensify, making the situation out of hand.

example.name: out_of_hand-m: from coca
example.text: I'll moderate the conversation, so things don't get out of hand.

roleset.name: without thinking or consideration
roleset.note: OUT_OF_HAND-M NOTES: Added by Tim/Julia during initial MWE framing. Very adverbial for PB purposes, but needed for AMR

role.descr: thing done or rejected without thinking

example.name: out_of_hand-m: with possessive
example.text: The out of hand rejection of our proposal was offensive

example.name: out_of_hand-m: adverbial sense
example.text: "If your adviser rejects them out of hand, that' s a bad sign, " says Pfau

roleset.name: be culpable for the death or injuries of another
roleset.note: BLOOD_ON_HANDS-NOTES: Added by Tim during initial MWE framing.

example.name: blood_on_hands-m: amr data
example.text: Voting for a man with so much muslim blood on his hands, sad.

example.name: blood_on_hands-m: amr data
example.text: The leaders of this war have the blood of many thousands of people on their hands.

roleset.name: unwittingly contribute to and fall for one's manipulations
roleset.note: PLAY_INTO_ONES_HANDS-M NOTES: Added by Tim/Julia during initial MWE framing.

example.name: play_into_hands-m
example.text: I think he lies to get attention and goodness knows the Dr. Phil show and Michelle played right into his hands on that one.

roleset.name: nearby, spatially or temporally; be imminent
roleset.note: AT_HAND-M NOTES: Added by Tim/Julia during initial MWE framing.

role.descr: in relation to, near to what

example.name: temporal
example.text: The revolution is at hand, and we must free ourselves of the chains of political and economic slavery.

roleset.name: relevance
roleset.note: PLAY_INTO_ONES_HANDS-M NOTES: Added by Tim/Julia during initial MWE framing.

example.name: play_into_hands-m
example.text: I think he lies to get attention and goodness knows the Dr. Phil show and Michelle played right into his hands on that one.

roleset.name: available
roleset.note: PLAY_INTO_ONES_HANDS-M NOTES: Added by Tim/Julia during initial MWE framing.

role.descr: available to whom/what? entity having access to arg2

example.name: play_into_hands-m
example.text: someone else has to be on hand to give out the drugs

example.name: play_into_hands-m
example.text: Once or twice a week, Kinser likes to spiral-cut veggies to have them on hand for quick meals, the cut-ahead veggies stored airtight in the refrigerator.

example.name: play_into_hands-m
example.text: Thus, he kept him at hand in the role of scribe, which is a far more honourable role among the Greeks than among the Roman.
example.arg: in the role of scribe, which is a far more honourable role among the Greeks than among the Roman.

roleset.name: aid, help
roleset.note: PLAY_INTO_ONES_HANDS-M NOTES: Added by Tim/Julia during initial MWE framing.

role.descr: benefactive, secondary agent (when separate from arg1)

example.name: give-hand-m
example.text: they are generous people that will always lend a hand to anyone in need.

example.name: give-hand-m
example.text: I have come over to give a hand any way I can help.

roleset.name: have a hand in; participate in, or have a causal role in, an activity
roleset.note: PLAY_INTO_ONES_HANDS-M NOTES: Added by Tim/Julia during initial MWE framing.

example.name: participate
example.text: It would indicate she had a hand in the destruction.
